workflow.name: Automate invoice processing with Gmail, OCR.space, Slack & Xero
workflow.description:
**How It Works**

1. **Trigger**: Watches for new emails in Gmail with PDF/image attachments.  
2. **OCR**: Sends the attachment to OCR.space API (https://ocr.space/OCRAPI) to extract invoice text.  
3. **Parsing**: Extracts key fields:  
   - Vendor  
   - Invoice number  
   - Amount  
   - Currency  
   - Invoice date  
   - Due date  
   - Description  
4. **Validation Logic**:  
   - Checks if amount is valid  
   - Ensures vendor and invoice number are present  
   - Flags high-value invoices (e.g., over $10,000)  
5. **Routing**:  
   - If invalid: 
   - Sends a Slack message highlighting issues
   - Labels email as **Rejected**  
   - If valid:  
     - Logs the invoice into Google Sheets  
     - Sends a Slack message to the finance team for approval  
     - After approval, creates a draft invoice in Xero  
     - Labels the email as **Processed** in Gmail  
________________________________________
**Set up steps**

‚Ä¢	Estimated setup time: 45-60 mins
‚Ä¢	You‚Äôll need connected credentials for Gmail, Slack, Google Sheets, and Xero
‚Ä¢	Replace the default API key for OCR.space with your own (in the HTTP Request node)
‚Ä¢	Update Slack channel IDs and label IDs to match your workspace
‚Ä¢	Adjust invoice validation rules as needed (e.g. currency, red flag conditions)

All detailed explanations and field mappings are provided in sticky notes within the workflow.

nodes.name: Append or update row in sheet

parameters.content:
### Automate Invoice Processing with Gmail, OCR.space, Slack & Xero

This n8n template demonstrates how to automatically extract, validate, approve, and sync invoices received via email using AI and automation ‚Äî reducing manual processing time and minimizing errors.

### Use Cases

- Finance teams looking to eliminate invoice approval bottlenecks  
- Businesses that receive PDF/image invoices via email  
- Companies currently logging invoices manually into spreadsheets or accounting tools  

### How It Works

1. **Trigger**: Watches for new emails in Gmail with PDF/image attachments.  
2. **OCR**: Sends the attachment to OCR.space API (https://ocr.space/OCRAPI) to extract invoice text.  
3. **Parsing**: Extracts key fields:  
   - Vendor  
   - Invoice number  
   - Amount  
   - Currency  
   - Invoice date  
   - Due date  
   - Description  
4. **Validation Logic**:  
   - Checks if amount is valid  
   - Ensures vendor and invoice number are present  
   - Flags high-value invoices (e.g., over $10,000)  
5. **Routing**:  
   - If invalid: 
   - Sends a Slack message highlighting issues
   - Labels email as **Rejected**  
   - If valid:  
     - Logs the invoice into Google Sheets  
     - Sends a Slack message to the finance team for approval  
     - After approval, creates a draft invoice in Xero  
     - Labels the email as **Processed** in Gmail  

### Customisation Options

- Swap Gmail trigger with a file uploader or webhook  
- Adjust the Slack notification channels or approval thresholds  
- Replace Xero with QuickBooks, Zoho, or another tool  
- Adapt log storage from Google Sheets to Airtable or Notion  
- Add a reminder flow if no approval is received within 24h  

### Prerequisites/Credential Setup

To use this workflow securely, you'll need the following credentials set up in n8n:

- **Gmail OAuth2** ‚Äì to watch for incoming invoice emails and apply labels
- **OCR.space API** ‚Äì create an HTTP Credential in n8n named `ocrspaceApi`, with your OCR.space key
- **Slack OAuth2 or Webhook (with connected bot)** ‚Äì to send approval/rejection messages to your team
- **Google Sheets OAuth2 credentials** ‚Äì to log processed invoices for audit and tracking
- **Xero OAuth2 credentials (via n8n‚Äôs native integration)** ‚Äì connect your Xero account to push approved invoices in Draft status
 
### Secure Configuration
- All credential fields use **n8n Credential Types**  
- No sensitive data (API keys, spreadsheet IDs) is hardcoded  

### Why This Helps

- Reduces time spent manually reviewing and copying invoices
- Maintains structured logs with clean data
- Automates Slack approvals and reduces email back-and-forth
- Improves audit trails and AP visibility across tools

---
With this template, finance teams can streamline invoice approvals, reduce processing time, and maintain a clean audit trail, all fully automated.

## 2. Approve or Reject Invoice in Slack
[Read more about Slack Approval workflows in n8n](https://docs.n8n.io/integrations/slack/)

After parsing, the workflow evaluates whether the invoice meets preset criteria (e.g., approved vendors or amount limits). It logs the result in a Google Sheet and sends a Slack message for manual approval. Based on the response, it either proceeds to Xero or marks it as rejected.

Setup Tip: Replace YOUR_SLACK_CLIENT_ID with the Client ID from your Slack apps page - https://api.slack.com/apps.

## 1. Extract & Parse Invoice from Gmail
[Read more about the Gmail and HTTP Request nodes](https://docs.n8n.io/integrations/builtin/email-read-imap/)
  
This section listens for new emails via Gmail, checks if an attachment exists and is valid, then extracts and parses invoice data using OCR (via OCR.Space API). The data is cleaned and prepared for downstream steps.

Setup Tip: Replace YOUR_GOOGLE_CLIENT_ID with the Client ID from your Google Console - https://console.cloud.google.com/ for your Google Sheets, Google Docs, Gmail.

## 3. Sync Outcome to Xero & Notify
[Read more about Xero and Gmail automation](https://docs.n8n.io/integrations/xero/)

If the invoice is approved, the workflow fetches the contact from Xero, creates the invoice, updates Gmail labels, logs final status in Google Sheets, and sends a success message in Slack. If rejected, it applies a different Gmail label, updates status, and notifies the team.

main.node: Append or update row in sheet

data.details:
The IF node can be used to implement binary conditional logic in your workflow. You can set up one-to-many conditions to evaluate each item of data being inputted into the node. That data will either evaluate to TRUE or FALSE and route out of the node accordingly.

This node has multiple types of conditions: Bool, String, Number, and Date & Time.
